review: Chromecast is easy to install (just plug into an HD TV) and use (download a Chrome browser add-on or mobile app) from any electronic with Chrome browser. The Google Chromecast website lists the music and video sites/apps that work with Chromecast, which are popular sites that I use all the time. Keep in mind that you can only cast from a Chrome browser or Chrome-based apps. It doesn't work with iTunes right now.  You only need: HD TV (with HDMI port), wireless internet, and Chrome on an electronic device (computer, smartphone, tablet).
author: Brittany

review: I've tried over and over to connect to my wireless network, and it won't do it.  I know what I'm doing - I have connected several laptops, Roku, Sony DVD/streamer, iPhone, etc.  The only guidance Chromecast provides is "contact Linksys for assistance."  No, I'm not going through that.  Chromecast should connect to my network, just like every other hardware I have.  I'm very disappointed in it.  Lame wireless connection capability.*****I did some research and learned that the problem with the Linksys router is that the Chrome does not like its n band. n band is standard now, it's not "new" any more, so this is still pretty lame, but if you know how to split the bands and you link to the g band from the router instead of dual/n, it can work. The signal is much weaker on g (thus n band wifi...), and the quality is not as good as I expected, it cuts out frequently, but now it works. Upgrading my rating to two stars since at least it works, and it streams content from the Google Chrome browser which I had to plug a HDMI cable into my computer to do previously.
